Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: newjerseysuccesstory
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend towards the end of November last year after our other accommodation cancelled on us at the last minute. I wasn't initally convinced about the area (our taxi driver from the airport couldn't find it!) but it beame clear in the morning that the area was fantastic. Just minutes away from Repubblica underground station and on a street lined with loads of shops, restaurants and fast food joints (2 McDonalds and a Burger King). Can't fault the location, or the staff at the reception who were lovely and were more than happy to help us with directions or anything else. However, everything else wasn't wonderful. While the reception staff (who are interchangable with the bar staff) were lovely, none of the staff in the bar were nearly as nice. Our Italian was terrible, but they automatically spoke to us in English but were very curt and aprupt. Breakfast itself wasn't bad for the room price, very basic. The room we had was very basic and the hot water failed us on the third day. The wheel on my bed also broke on the last night It was quite warm but for some reason the windows wouldn't open. Add to that the building site that was the church next door and the noise from the pub until 3 in the morning directly beneath us it wasn't the quietest either! I think this would be fine for students or interrailing travellers who want something fairly cheap, but anything else wouldn't really suit!

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: mario m
Reviews.Content: Just few rooms over a pub. Rooms are not clean but the main problem is the the loud music coming from the pub downstairs. On sunday the breakfast is available only from 09:00 o'clock and on our check out we left without having breakfast ( we didn't lose much because the breakfast is awfull )

Reviews.Title: “It's good for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: therecordstore
Reviews.Content: its nothing special. it has some nice things like excellent wifi, very clean, the location is great. but on the other hand, the room is the size of a shoebox... seriously. also, my room faced this dingy looking area... i don't know, but it looked shady (it was like the inside of the building? i don't know). if you're not spending much time in the hotel room, then it is perfect, it's on via firenze which is off via nazionale, you're close to two metro stops and termini, all the shopping you could want, and so much more :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable bed, basic room”
Reviews.Author: FranFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable bed, basic room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: CarolCoronel
Reviews.Content: I loved the location, the breakfast, although is in a different building, kind help us leaving earlier and having more time to visit and enjoy such a beautiful and historical city. The underground is a couple blocks away and there is some stores at walking distance. The only inconvenience, if you could say so, is that we check in a few blocks away from the actual building, and with suitcases, it can be a little overwhelming for some people traveling with many items. If you want a great restaurant suggestion: la taverna dei Monti, Via del Boschetto, 41, 00184 Roma - maybe 6 or 7 blocks away but we had dinner 3 out of 6 days we stayed in Rome. Not fancy, a family restaurant, Great food. Every single plate we ordered was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for rome”
Reviews.Author: claudiuuuu
Reviews.Content: we ve booked it for 6 nights and in the first night we were checked in a small room a little claustrophobic but i think they only use that for emergency until a bigger one is gonna be released,we changed rooms the next day in a bigger one ....much better ,nice wiew,room very clean ...the boy that takes care of them is a wee gem ....totonio ...don t really know it s name ....but he does a hell of a job ....he s the smiley lovley guy that u see in the morning ....every day room was cleaned ....towells bed and so on ..very happy with his service:) hot water...i really don t have anything to complain about ....we were put a a near by building and not in the rooms above the restaurant ....via firenze just a minute walk from the pub ...i totally recoommend that ...it s quiet,u ve got air con safe basically everything u need,this place is perfect to get anywhere ...i mean u can literally walk and get where ever u want .....apart from the vatican where u can take the metro or bus ....u ve got everything next to u ...it s hassle free ...the manager gave us a map clear indications ...everything was so simple .....the restaurant itself is does the best roast potatoes that i ever had :D food is good nicely cooked ( i m a chef) breakfast is continental but as a quest u get discount for full breakfast wich i reccommend it again ...that pancetta with their scrambled eggs ...u can t find them in the UK,overall i wanna thank all the staff there we had a great time in rome!!,PS taxi fare in rome make sure it s always TARIFF number 1 ...

Reviews.Title: “No windows, noisy, bitten in room 12 times by mosquitoes at night”
Reviews.Author: OMcGovern
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 103 above the pub. The location was perfect for me, 100 metres from the Republica Metro station. But this isn't a hotel, it's like a half pub half hotel, so the staff seem to be from the pub. If you need anything you have to go to the pub and get their attention, in between them serving people at the bar. The room had no windows, well there was a 2x1 foot window above a locked door leading out to the roof I think. The room was clean enough, en-suite, TV with plenty of stations ( only found 2 English TV stations), safety deposit box and small chilled mini-bar. The air conditioning unit in my room didn't seem to work well. At night, there was a lot of noise from various machinery/air conditioning units/fans etc outside. ( which was behind the hotel on various flat roofs ) I had brought foam earplugs which solved that issue. Then there were about 4 mosquitoes in my room, and when I turned off the light to sleep they took turns biting me. I have 12 bite marks at the moment. I'd be worried about the same mosquitoes biting numerous guests and transmitting disease between them. There was the red blood splattered remains of 5 other mosquitoes on the ceiling were other guests had the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “Bring an alarm, an accurate clock, and good walking shoes...”
Reviews.Author: AllAround24
Reviews.Content: The room was a 5 minute walk from the check-in. They offered no wake-up call. They gave us an alarm that didn't work. The clock in the room was off by an hour. These factors led to our unfortunate late arrival at the airport. Know what you're getting when you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: livioMilano
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place. We couldn't sleep at night because the disco pub dowstairs. The music was very loud till three o'clock at night. Our room was just under the kitchen of the same pub and can hear all the noise till late in the evening expecially when they beat the food.They offer the breakfast in the same pub and the first day we did feel bad all day long with the stomac. A disaster and wouldn't suggest this place even to the worste enemy.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: airqueen
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small hotel in the center of Rome this could be for you. They have only 11 rooms 4 above the Irish bar and the other 7 are across the road around a side street. You go through a main door and up a lift to the second floor and then another key to get into the foyer area rooms are off this We were first given room 104 which was very small and dark due to being in the center of the building so your outlook was into the well of the building. Not good Tonnio arranged a change of room the next day. Room 103 this one looked out onto the street with a small balconey. My friends were given the family room which sleeped 3 comfortable over looking the quite street. We were awoken to the sound of church bells every morning Fab. Rooms are small but very clean and modern. Good shower although small so do not drop your soap.If they wanted to improve their rooms l would recommend they put in a tall mirror for us ladies and please tea/coffe making it is a long walk in the morning to get that first coffe fix.. Breakfast is taken at the Irish bar and is the bog standard coffee,orange juice toast and croissant all waiter service if you want to upgrade to a cooked breakfast there is only a small charge. Best of all you can walk to all the sites. It is in a safe part on the city. The manager will do all he can to make your holiday great.

HotelInfo.Name: Flann O'Brien Rooms
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale, 17, 00184 Rome, Italy
